channel.title: Experimenting with layers
channel.description:
I've just finished my new homepage and i'm pretty pleased with the outcome, the method I used was pretty simple, but I think it came out pretty good, all I did was get a few images, put is as a 'lower layer' in the psd, and then used a circular eraser to make holes in the 'main' layer. :D
I was also pretty pleased with my logo at the top, I can't remember how I did it, I think it was something to do with the blending effects I used on the font, and I accidently added the logo on the same layer >_<
Anyway yeah ^_^ [IMG]http://i18.tinypic.com/34imlgy.png[/img][br][size=1]Posted on: April 20, 2007, 03:32:46 PM[/size][hr]Eeeee. I need cc >_<

item.title: Experimenting with layers

item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

Ummm… Worst text ever… Bevel and emboss == Fugly on the back…

Whats up with the dog icon?.. Overused vector brushes…Which look splattery llike…

item.title: Experimenting with layers
item.dc:creator: @JV1 JV
item.description:
@JV1 wrote:

I’ve just finished my new homepage and i’m pretty pleased with the outcome, the method I used was pretty simple, but I think it came out pretty good, all I did was get a few images, put is as a ‘lower layer’ in the psd, and then used a circular eraser to make holes in the ‘main’ layer.

I was also pretty pleased with my logo at the top, I can’t remember how I did it, I think it was something to do with the blending effects I used on the font, and I accidently added the logo on the same layer >_<

Anyway yeah ^^
